Bird | blank3_info_sec1 = | blank4_name_sec1 = -Fish | blank4_info_sec1 = | blank5_name_sec1 = | blank5_info_sec1 = | blank6_name_sec1 = | blank6_info_sec1 = | blank7_name_sec1 = | blank7_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = Phone number | blank_info_sec2 = 0238-22-5111 | blank1_name_sec2 = Address | blank1_info_sec2 = 5-2-25 Kanaike, Yonezawa-shi, Yamagata-ken 992-8501 | website = http://www.city.yonezawa.yamagata.jp/ | footnotes = }} is a Japanese city in Yamagata Prefecture on the island of Honshu.Deal, William E. (2005). Handbook to Life in Medieval and Early Modern Japan, p. 81. ==History== The castle town was held by the Uesugi clan starting in the Muromachi period. The modern city was established in 1889. ==Related== == Other websites == * Yonezawa City website Category:Cities in Yamagata Prefecture
